data.title: German Exchange
data.meta_description: Hudson High School Goes to Germany
data.text:
Die Grenze – East/West Border

Our first stop today was at Marienborn. This is a memorial dedicated to the division of Germany into two parts, East Germany and West Germany. The Marienborn border was a checkpoint between Helmstedt and Alleringersleben where German and European citizens were not only separated by a wall but by two different economic systems, beliefs and […]

Posted in: 2019 Trip

A Day in Braunschweig

Monday the exchange students, accompanied by their hosts, explored the city of Braunschweig. Way back in the day, the city was actually five separate districts. These districts came together and were unified in the eleventh century. There are some older structures that still survive in the city, but the majority of it was destroyed in […]

Posted in: 2019 Trip

A Day in Berlin

Today we spent the day in Berlin: a city rich with history from as early as the 13th century. After visiting the Reichstag Building, we made our way to the famous Brandenburg Tor (Gate). Approaching the gate that once separated East and West Germany was incredible. It was amazing to be standing in the same […]

Posted in: 2019 Trip

Braunschweig: yesterday & today

Today our group traveled to the city of Braunschweig, one of the oldest cities in Germany founded in the 900’s. The city is different than most cities within Lower Saxony as the dominant animal in artwork and buildings is the lion, whereas the rest of Lower Saxony uses wolves in art. Braunschweig is a city […]

Posted in: 2019 Trip
